00004 /*
00005  * This code implements the MD5 message-digest algorithm.
00006  * The algorithm is due to Ron Rivest.  This code was
00007  * written by Colin Plumb in 1993, no copyright is claimed.
00008  * This code is in the public domain; do with it what you wish.
00009  *
00010  * Equivalent code is available from RSA Data Security, Inc.
00011  * This code has been tested against that, and is equivalent,
00012  * except that you don't need to include two pages of legalese
00013  * with every copy.
00014  *
00015  * To compute the message digest of a chunk of bytes, declare an
00016  * MD5Context structure, pass it to MD5Init, call MD5Update as
00017  * needed on buffers full of bytes, and then call MD5Final, which
00018  * will fill a supplied 16-byte array with the digest.
00019  */
00020 
00021 #include "md5.h"
00022 
00023 #include <stdint.h>
00024 #include <cstring>
00025 #include <string>
00026 
00027 typedef uint32_t uint32;
00028 
00029 struct Context {
00030   uint32 buf[4];
00031   uint32 bits[2];
00032   unsigned char in[64];
00033 };
00034 
00035 /*
00036  * Note: this code is harmless on little-endian machines.
00037  */
00038 static void byteReverse(unsigned char *buf, unsigned longs) {
00039   uint32 t;
00040   do {
00041     t = static_cast<uint32>(static_cast<unsigned>(buf[3])<<8 | buf[2]) << 16 |
00042         (static_cast<unsigned>(buf[1])<<8 | buf[0]);
00043     *(reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(buf)) = t;
00044     buf += 4;
00045   } while (--longs);
00046 }
00047 /* The four core functions - F1 is optimized somewhat */
00048 
00049 /* #define F1(x, y, z) (x & y | ~x & z) */
00050 #define F1(x, y, z) (z ^ (x & (y ^ z)))
00051 #define F2(x, y, z) F1(z, x, y)
00052 #define F3(x, y, z) (x ^ y ^ z)
00053 #define F4(x, y, z) (y ^ (x | ~z))
00054 
00055 /* This is the central step in the MD5 algorithm. */
00056 #define MD5STEP(f, w, x, y, z, data, s) \
00057         (w += f(x, y, z) + data,  w = w << s | w >> (32 - s) ,  w += x)
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * The core of the MD5 algorithm, this alters an existing MD5 hash to
00061  * reflect the addition of 16 longwords of new data.  MD5Update blocks
00062  * the data and converts bytes into longwords for this routine.
00063  */
00064 static void MD5Transform(uint32 buf[4], const uint32 in[16]) {
00065   register uint32 a, b, c, d;
00066 
00067   a = buf[0];
00068   b = buf[1];
00069   c = buf[2];
00070   d = buf[3];
00071 
00072   MD5STEP(F1, a, b, c, d, in[ 0]+0xd76aa478,  7);
00073   MD5STEP(F1, d, a, b, c, in[ 1]+0xe8c7b756, 12);
00074   MD5STEP(F1, c, d, a, b, in[ 2]+0x242070db, 17);
00075   MD5STEP(F1, b, c, d, a, in[ 3]+0xc1bdceee, 22);
00076   MD5STEP(F1, a, b, c, d, in[ 4]+0xf57c0faf,  7);
00077   MD5STEP(F1, d, a, b, c, in[ 5]+0x4787c62a, 12);
00078   MD5STEP(F1, c, d, a, b, in[ 6]+0xa8304613, 17);
00079   MD5STEP(F1, b, c, d, a, in[ 7]+0xfd469501, 22);
00080   MD5STEP(F1, a, b, c, d, in[ 8]+0x698098d8,  7);
00081   MD5STEP(F1, d, a, b, c, in[ 9]+0x8b44f7af, 12);
00082   MD5STEP(F1, c, d, a, b, in[10]+0xffff5bb1, 17);
00083   MD5STEP(F1, b, c, d, a, in[11]+0x895cd7be, 22);
00084   MD5STEP(F1, a, b, c, d, in[12]+0x6b901122,  7);
00085   MD5STEP(F1, d, a, b, c, in[13]+0xfd987193, 12);
00086   MD5STEP(F1, c, d, a, b, in[14]+0xa679438e, 17);
00087   MD5STEP(F1, b, c, d, a, in[15]+0x49b40821, 22);
00088 
00089   MD5STEP(F2, a, b, c, d, in[ 1]+0xf61e2562,  5);
00090   MD5STEP(F2, d, a, b, c, in[ 6]+0xc040b340,  9);
00091   MD5STEP(F2, c, d, a, b, in[11]+0x265e5a51, 14);
00092   MD5STEP(F2, b, c, d, a, in[ 0]+0xe9b6c7aa, 20);
00093   MD5STEP(F2, a, b, c, d, in[ 5]+0xd62f105d,  5);
00094   MD5STEP(F2, d, a, b, c, in[10]+0x02441453,  9);
00095   MD5STEP(F2, c, d, a, b, in[15]+0xd8a1e681, 14);
00096   MD5STEP(F2, b, c, d, a, in[ 4]+0xe7d3fbc8, 20);
00097   MD5STEP(F2, a, b, c, d, in[ 9]+0x21e1cde6,  5);
00098   MD5STEP(F2, d, a, b, c, in[14]+0xc33707d6,  9);
00099   MD5STEP(F2, c, d, a, b, in[ 3]+0xf4d50d87, 14);
00100   MD5STEP(F2, b, c, d, a, in[ 8]+0x455a14ed, 20);
00101   MD5STEP(F2, a, b, c, d, in[13]+0xa9e3e905,  5);
00102   MD5STEP(F2, d, a, b, c, in[ 2]+0xfcefa3f8,  9);
00103   MD5STEP(F2, c, d, a, b, in[ 7]+0x676f02d9, 14);
00104   MD5STEP(F2, b, c, d, a, in[12]+0x8d2a4c8a, 20);
00105 
00106   MD5STEP(F3, a, b, c, d, in[ 5]+0xfffa3942,  4);
00107   MD5STEP(F3, d, a, b, c, in[ 8]+0x8771f681, 11);
00108   MD5STEP(F3, c, d, a, b, in[11]+0x6d9d6122, 16);
00109   MD5STEP(F3, b, c, d, a, in[14]+0xfde5380c, 23);
00110   MD5STEP(F3, a, b, c, d, in[ 1]+0xa4beea44,  4);
00111   MD5STEP(F3, d, a, b, c, in[ 4]+0x4bdecfa9, 11);
00112   MD5STEP(F3, c, d, a, b, in[ 7]+0xf6bb4b60, 16);
00113   MD5STEP(F3, b, c, d, a, in[10]+0xbebfbc70, 23);
00114   MD5STEP(F3, a, b, c, d, in[13]+0x289b7ec6,  4);
00115   MD5STEP(F3, d, a, b, c, in[ 0]+0xeaa127fa, 11);
00116   MD5STEP(F3, c, d, a, b, in[ 3]+0xd4ef3085, 16);
00117   MD5STEP(F3, b, c, d, a, in[ 6]+0x04881d05, 23);
00118   MD5STEP(F3, a, b, c, d, in[ 9]+0xd9d4d039,  4);
00119   MD5STEP(F3, d, a, b, c, in[12]+0xe6db99e5, 11);
00120   MD5STEP(F3, c, d, a, b, in[15]+0x1fa27cf8, 16);
00121   MD5STEP(F3, b, c, d, a, in[ 2]+0xc4ac5665, 23);
00122 
00123   MD5STEP(F4, a, b, c, d, in[ 0]+0xf4292244,  6);
00124   MD5STEP(F4, d, a, b, c, in[ 7]+0x432aff97, 10);
00125   MD5STEP(F4, c, d, a, b, in[14]+0xab9423a7, 15);
00126   MD5STEP(F4, b, c, d, a, in[ 5]+0xfc93a039, 21);
00127   MD5STEP(F4, a, b, c, d, in[12]+0x655b59c3,  6);
00128   MD5STEP(F4, d, a, b, c, in[ 3]+0x8f0ccc92, 10);
00129   MD5STEP(F4, c, d, a, b, in[10]+0xffeff47d, 15);
00130   MD5STEP(F4, b, c, d, a, in[ 1]+0x85845dd1, 21);
00131   MD5STEP(F4, a, b, c, d, in[ 8]+0x6fa87e4f,  6);
00132   MD5STEP(F4, d, a, b, c, in[15]+0xfe2ce6e0, 10);
00133   MD5STEP(F4, c, d, a, b, in[ 6]+0xa3014314, 15);
00134   MD5STEP(F4, b, c, d, a, in[13]+0x4e0811a1, 21);
00135   MD5STEP(F4, a, b, c, d, in[ 4]+0xf7537e82,  6);
00136   MD5STEP(F4, d, a, b, c, in[11]+0xbd3af235, 10);
00137   MD5STEP(F4, c, d, a, b, in[ 2]+0x2ad7d2bb, 15);
00138   MD5STEP(F4, b, c, d, a, in[ 9]+0xeb86d391, 21);
00139 
00140   buf[0] += a;
00141   buf[1] += b;
00142   buf[2] += c;
00143   buf[3] += d;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*
00147  * Start MD5 accumulation.  Set bit count to 0 and buffer to mysterious
00148  * initialization constants.
00149  */
00150 void MD5Init(MD5Context *pCtx) {
00151   struct Context *ctx = (struct Context *)pCtx;
00152   ctx->buf[0] = 0x67452301;
00153   ctx->buf[1] = 0xefcdab89;
00154   ctx->buf[2] = 0x98badcfe;
00155   ctx->buf[3] = 0x10325476;
00156   ctx->bits[0] = 0;
00157   ctx->bits[1] = 0;
00158 }
00159 
00160 /*
00161  * Update context to reflect the concatenation of another buffer full
00162  * of bytes.
00163  */
00164 void MD5Update(MD5Context *pCtx, const void *inbuf, size_t len) {
00165   struct Context *ctx = (struct Context *)pCtx;
00166   const unsigned char* buf = (const unsigned char*)inbuf;
00167   uint32 t;
00168 
00169   /* Update bitcount */
00170 
00171   t = ctx->bits[0];
00172   if ((ctx->bits[0] = t + (static_cast<uint32>(len) << 3)) < t)
00173     ctx->bits[1]++; /* Carry from low to high */
00174   ctx->bits[1] += static_cast<uint32>(len >> 29);
00175 
00176   t = (t >> 3) & 0x3f;    /* Bytes already in shsInfo->data */
00177 
00178   /* Handle any leading odd-sized chunks */
00179 
00180   if (t) {
00181     unsigned char *p = (unsigned char *)ctx->in + t;
00182 
00183     t = 64-t;
00184     if (len < t) {
00185       memcpy(p, buf, len);
00186       return;
00187     }
00188     memcpy(p, buf, t);
00189     byteReverse(ctx->in, 16);
00190     MD5Transform(ctx->buf, reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in));
00191     buf += t;
00192     len -= t;
00193   }
00194 
00195   /* Process data in 64-byte chunks */
00196 
00197   while (len >= 64) {
00198     memcpy(ctx->in, buf, 64);
00199     byteReverse(ctx->in, 16);
00200     MD5Transform(ctx->buf, reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in));
00201     buf += 64;
00202     len -= 64;
00203   }
00204 
00205   /* Handle any remaining bytes of data. */
00206 
00207   memcpy(ctx->in, buf, len);
00208 }
00209 
00210 /*
00211  * Final wrapup - pad to 64-byte boundary with the bit pattern
00212  * 1 0* (64-bit count of bits processed, MSB-first)
00213  */
00214 void MD5Final(MD5Digest* digest, MD5Context *pCtx) {
00215   struct Context *ctx = (struct Context *)pCtx;
00216   unsigned count;
00217   unsigned char *p;
00218 
00219   /* Compute number of bytes mod 64 */
00220   count = (ctx->bits[0] >> 3) & 0x3F;
00221 
00222   /* Set the first char of padding to 0x80.  This is safe since there is
00223      always at least one byte free */
00224   p = ctx->in + count;
00225   *p++ = 0x80;
00226 
00227   /* Bytes of padding needed to make 64 bytes */
00228   count = 64 - 1 - count;
00229 
00230   /* Pad out to 56 mod 64 */
00231   if (count < 8) {
00232     /* Two lots of padding:  Pad the first block to 64 bytes */
00233     memset(p, 0, count);
00234     byteReverse(ctx->in, 16);
00235     MD5Transform(ctx->buf, reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in));
00236 
00237     /* Now fill the next block with 56 bytes */
00238     memset(ctx->in, 0, 56);
00239   } else {
00240     /* Pad block to 56 bytes */
00241     memset(p, 0, count-8);
00242   }
00243   byteReverse(ctx->in, 14);
00244 
00245   /* Append length in bits and transform */
00246   (reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in))[ 14 ] = ctx->bits[0];
00247   (reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in))[ 15 ] = ctx->bits[1];
00248 
00249   MD5Transform(ctx->buf, reinterpret_cast<uint32*>(ctx->in));
00250   byteReverse((unsigned char *)ctx->buf, 4);
00251   memcpy(digest->a, ctx->buf, 16);
00252   memset(ctx, 0, sizeof(ctx));    /* In case it's sensitive */
00253 }
00254 
00255 std::string MD5DigestToBase16(const MD5Digest& digest) {
00256   static char const zEncode[] = "0123456789abcdef";
00257 
00258   std::string ret;
00259   ret.resize(32);
00260 
00261   int j = 0;
00262   for (int i = 0; i < 16; i ++) {
00263     int a = digest.a[i];
00264     ret[j++] = zEncode[(a>>4)&0xf];
00265     ret[j++] = zEncode[a & 0xf];
00266   }
00267   return ret;
00268 }
00269 
00270 void MD5Sum(const void* data, size_t length, MD5Digest* digest) {
00271   MD5Context ctx;
00272   MD5Init(&ctx);
00273   MD5Update(&ctx, static_cast<const unsigned char*>(data), length);
00274   MD5Final(digest, &ctx);
00275 }
00276 
00277 std::string MD5String(const std::string& str) {
00278   MD5Digest digest;
00279   MD5Sum(str.data(), str.length(), &digest);
00280   return MD5DigestToBase16(digest);
00281 }
